title: Live Exploitation Underscores Urgency to Patch Critical WS-FTP Server Flaw
description:
Rapid7 says attackers are targeting a critical pre-authentication flaw in Progress Software’s WS_FTP server just days after disclosure.

The post Live Exploitation Underscores Urgency to Patch Critical WS-FTP Server Flaw appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: European Telecommunications Standards Institute Discloses Data Breach
description:
Hackers stole a database containing the list of the European Telecommunications Standards Institute’s online users.

The post European Telecommunications Standards Institute Discloses Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Number of Internet-Exposed ICS Drops Below 100,000: Report
description:
The number of internet-exposed ICS has dropped below 100,000, a significant decrease from the 140,000 in 2019.

The post Number of Internet-Exposed ICS Drops Below 100,000: Report appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Johnson Controls Ransomware Attack Could Impact DHS
description:
DHS is reportedly investigating the impact of the recent Johnson Controls ransomware attack on its systems and facilities.

The post Johnson Controls Ransomware Attack Could Impact DHS appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Unpatched Exim Vulnerabilities Expose Many Mail Servers to Attacks
description:
Patches are being developed for serious Exim vulnerabilities that could expose many mail servers to attacks. 

The post Unpatched Exim Vulnerabilities Expose Many Mail Servers to Attacks  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: CISA Kicks Off Cybersecurity Awareness Month With New Program
description:
CISA has announced the Secure Our World cybersecurity awareness program, targeting both businesses and end users.

The post CISA Kicks Off Cybersecurity Awareness Month With New Program appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Recently Patched TeamCity Vulnerability Exploited to Hack Servers
description:
In-the-wild exploitation of a critical vulnerability in the TeamCity CI/CD server started shortly after a patch was released by developers.

The post Recently Patched TeamCity Vulnerability Exploited to Hack Servers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Silverfort Open Sources Lateral Movement Detection Tool
description:
Silverfort has released the source code for its lateral movement detection tool LATMA, to help identify and analyze intrusions.

The post Silverfort Open Sources Lateral Movement Detection Tool appeared first on SecurityWeek.
